body:
## ðŸ“š Domain Task - Core Entity Development

### Overview
Define and implement the core domain entities Course and Teacher with rich domain models following Domain-Driven Design principles.

### Scope
This task completes the core domain entity modeling for EduTrack's academic management system.

### Implementation Checklist

#### Course Entity Development
- [ ] Create Course aggregate root with business logic
- [ ] Implement CourseCode value object (e.g., "CS101", "MATH201")
- [ ] Implement Credits value object with validation (1-6 credits)
- [ ] Add CourseLevel enumeration (Undergraduate, Graduate, Doctoral)
- [ ] Create Prerequisites collection with validation logic
- [ ] Implement course capacity management (min/max enrollment)
- [ ] Add course schedule integration (days, times, rooms)
- [ ] Create course status management (Active, Inactive, Archived)
- [ ] Implement course version tracking for curriculum changes
- [ ] Add course description and learning outcomes

#### Teacher Entity Development
- [ ] Create Teacher aggregate root with faculty-specific logic
- [ ] Implement EmployeeId value object with format validation
- [ ] Create Department assignment with hierarchy support
- [ ] Add Qualification collection (degrees, certifications)
- [ ] Implement teaching load calculation and limits
- [ ] Create office hours and availability management
- [ ] Add performance evaluation tracking
- [ ] Implement tenure and employment status
- [ ] Create research interests and specializations
- [ ] Add contact information and emergency contacts

#### Domain Relationships
- [ ] Define Course-Teacher assignment relationships
- [ ] Implement Course-Student enrollment relationships
- [ ] Create Department-Teacher hierarchy
- [ ] Add Course-Prerequisites dependency validation
- [ ] Implement Teacher workload distribution logic

#### Business Rules Implementation
- [ ] Course prerequisite validation logic
- [ ] Teacher workload calculation and limits
- [ ] Course capacity enforcement
- [ ] Schedule conflict detection
- [ ] Academic calendar integration

### Technical Requirements

#### Entity Design Patterns
```csharp
// Example Course entity structure
public class Course : AggregateRoot<Guid>
{
    public CourseCode Code { get; private set; }
    public string Title { get; private set; }
    public Credits Credits { get; private set; }
    public CourseLevel Level { get; private set; }
    public Department Department { get; private set; }
    public IReadOnlyList<Course> Prerequisites { get; private set; }
    
    // Rich domain methods
    public bool CanEnroll(Student student) { /* validation logic */ }
    public void AssignTeacher(Teacher teacher) { /* assignment logic */ }
    public void UpdateCapacity(int minCapacity, int maxCapacity) { /* capacity logic */ }
}

// Example Teacher entity structure
public class Teacher : AggregateRoot<Guid>
{
    public EmployeeId EmployeeId { get; private set; }
    public FullName Name { get; private set; }
    public Email Email { get; private set; }
    public Department Department { get; private set; }
    public IReadOnlyList<Qualification> Qualifications { get; private set; }
    
    // Rich domain methods
    public bool CanTeachCourse(Course course) { /* qualification check */ }
    public void AssignToCourse(Course course) { /* assignment logic */ }
    public int CalculateTeachingLoad() { /* workload calculation */ }
}
```

#### Value Objects to Implement
- `CourseCode` - Course identifier with format validation
- `Credits` - Academic credit hours with business rules
- `EmployeeId` - Teacher identifier with institutional format
- `Qualification` - Academic degrees and certifications

#### Domain Events to Prepare For
- `CourseCreatedEvent`
- `TeacherAssignedToCourseEvent`
- `CourseCapacityChangedEvent`
- `TeacherHiredEvent`

### Testing Requirements
- [ ] Unit tests for Course entity business logic
- [ ] Unit tests for Teacher entity business logic
- [ ] Unit tests for all value objects
- [ ] Unit tests for domain relationships
- [ ] Unit tests for business rule validation
- [ ] Performance tests for complex entity operations

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Course entity implements all required business logic
- [ ] Teacher entity includes faculty-specific domain rules
- [ ] All value objects have proper validation
- [ ] Entity relationships are properly modeled
- [ ] Business rules are enforced at domain level
- [ ] Unit tests achieve >95% coverage
- [ ] Code follows Clean Architecture principles
- [ ] Domain events are prepared for future implementation
- [ ] Documentation includes domain model diagrams

### Dependencies
- Depends on: T002 Domain Layer Foundation (Value Objects completed)
- Blocks: Domain Events implementation, Domain Services implementation

### Estimated Effort
**6-8 hours** (2 full development sessions)

### Definition of Done
- [ ] All Course and Teacher entity functionality implemented
- [ ] All associated value objects created and tested
- [ ] Unit tests passing with >95% coverage
- [ ] Code review completed
- [ ] Documentation updated with entity relationships
- [ ] Integration with existing Student entity verified

### Priority
**High** - Foundation for all academic management features
